reference.shortdesc: A code block is a set of lines from a program.

section.title: Rendering expectations
section.p: Processors SHOULD preserve line the breaks and spaces that are present in the content of a codeblock element.
The content of the codeblock element is typically rendered in a monospaced font.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The codeblock element is specialized from pre. It is defined in the programming domain module.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: , , and xml:space.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows how the codeblock element can be used to tag an excerpt from the code for a program:
example.codeblock: <codeblock> /* a long sample program */ Do forever Say "Hello, World" End </codeblock>
